LG.L: But greine of whete in eorþe dye,
hit schal not newe. þis is to seie:
Whon grein of whete is cast to grounde,
But ȝif hit die, hit schal not newe.
Vre furste greyne wiþ deuȝ was bounde,
ffeole greynes þerof grewe,
Spires stoden vp In a stounde
And bar blosmes briht of hewe;
ffeole greynes growen rounde
Of o greyne þat we sewe.
whon greyn in grounde biginneþ falle,
But ȝif hit die, hit schal not sprede,
þe londus folk forte fede—
In Johan gospel þus I rede,
þe apostles witen alle.
Whon greyne of whete is cast in grounde, 16 l. in grounde is sowe.
hit liggeþ lowe vndur þe londe;
þerof springeþ spires I-nowe
Aȝein þe sonne vndur þe sonde,
wiþ bitter blastes hit is I-blowe,
To wagge wiþ wynd hit wol not wonde;
And aftur is ropen and leid ful lowe,
Boistesliche bounden in a bonde,
And þenne in cartes cast,
þen hit is brouht hom til a Berne,
hard I-þrosschen in an hurne;
ffair bred, as ȝe schul lerne,
þerof comeþ atte last.
þenne is hit winewed wiþ þe wynde,
In Mesures meten and grounden to mele,
ffeire I-kneden, as ȝe may se 31 se st. fynde?
Bake Bred and feden fele.
þis whete-corn I haue in muynde
þat furst stod on a luytel stele.
Nou wol I preue bi wei of kuynde
þat o greyne won al vr wele,
whon greyne on grounde was sowe
In Marie lond, þat Mylde croft;
þer-in com crist feire and soft
Out of heuene, þe heiȝe loft,
And greuh in grounde ful lowe.
Whon greyne of whete in grounde was cast,
Quikliche hit quiked in a Qweene.
here hit liuede, for vs hit fast
ffourti dawes, as clerkes sene;
In eorþe hit dyed atte last,
And queyntely hit quiked aȝen—
þat made þe fend sore agast;
Nou greyne is brouht in bred to ben.
Bote for vre greyne gon dye,
Schulde neuere Mayden ne wyf
Ones haue ete þe bred of lyf,
But euere ha liued in þe fendes strif,
fforsoþe, as I ow seye.
Whon þis spyr was sprad and spronge,
þritti wynter and al-most þre
wiþ fele wyndes hit (was) wronge,
Vre spir sprong al in pouerte.
he preched boþe olde and ȝonge,
And helede seke in mony cite.
Atte laste þe Jewes stronge
Scheren vr greyne ful lowe on kne—
þis me þinkeþ gret reuþe.
þe Jewes, þat (were) wikked and wrong,

his hondes þei bounden at his bac

whos heued þei knelled wiþ moni a knoc,

wiþ Jhesus þat diede for vre tres∣pas—

heroude, þat wikked þing,

ffleyles on hym gun flynge,

þe meke þing stod naked in þe chelle,
his cloþes þei wonnen atte dys, 99 Ms. wonnes.
And aftur leiden him doun ful stille
wiþ rode red so Rose on Rys.
þis Mayde seed was mete,

þis mon was mad ful mete.
In writ as hit is founde,

his senewes brooken euerichon
þus was vr greyne I-grounde.
On longe laddres vp þei trede,
þe Jewes þat weore wylde and wode,
Berien vre bred aȝeyn þe brede

Vre Cake on Crois þei knede,
Rampned hit harde aȝeyn þe Roode,
þat made vre Meole swetter þen mede. 118 Ms. moode.
þus for us was greyþed vr gostly foode,

þer he heng I-Robed in Red,
In druye blood, whon he was ded—
þus spekeþ seynt Luc of vre bred
In his gospel goode.
þo was he marked wiþ a launce,

he Ros vp at his ordinaunce
On Aster-day, whon þe day gon dawe,
whon bred of lyf was forþ i-drawe.
his feire feste doþ vs a-vaunce,
his flesch vs fedeþ, we may be fawe
of his Blessed Ordinaunce.
þus seide seint Thomas of Inde
his bred of lyf couþe he not knowe,
whuch a Lof þat was I-sowe,

þorw his bored breste gan fynde.
Kerueþ vr lof bi þe ouer syde,
ȝe þat ben Mylde makeþ ou þerwiþ wel atese,

what God haþ don ow wiþ to plese.
he bouhte blisse mon to abyde,
wiþ heuene-halle he gan ȝou sese,

Ȝit is he God, as he was born,

þe neoþur croste mai þe fulle:

hou grim, hou hot hit is in helle,
fful of pich, þat euer schal stynke,
I-ȝoten, and Brimston welle;

þer nis no clerk mai write wiþ Inke
half þe cumbring ne care.

Derknes and dym lyȝe.
þeih peter for a soule preye,
hit is not worþ a tare.

þenk hou þei schul warien heuene∣wynne,
fforsake crist and heore cristnynge;

ffor Poule and Gregori
þus þei rikenen bi an bi,

vr kun schal comen out of þe clay;

his face þenne schal vs fede,

DEre breþren, here we rede
On þis gospel, seiþ seint Bede,
whi Jon, Cristes forgoer, here
Cald him þe lomb of god so dere:
ffor he him kneuh for Innocent
And vndefoulet þer present,
þat is to sei of alle synne
þat euer was þe world wiþ-Inne.

he schulde be take wiþ wolues badde,

wiþ-oute noyse he schulde beo stille.
ffor Jon witnessed in þis plas

hedde most miht of þe godhede.

Schulde haue a verrey knowlechynge

he hem asked bi þat entent,

þis com of a wilful kynde,

ffor þei wolde ofte þider come

his dwellyng was, wiþ-outen fable,

hit was comen in þat stoure

he saiȝ þe sympelnes and þe quert

his Nettes alle he forsok,
him to suwe, as seiþ þe Bok.

And heore Nettes forsoke also,

Bote heore Nettes þat þei forsoke
To wite what þat is, good weore to loke.
þis Nettes beþ þus muche to telle
As hous and lond and oþur Catelle,
wyf and Child—at þis doing
þer þei forsoken al worliche þing;
þei forsoken also riht þere
Al fulþe of synne hat euer were,
And alle foule vices also,
Only wiþ god, heore lord, to go—
ffor wite we wel: hose ne doþ,
Crist may he not folwe, for-soþ.
ffor hose to crist wol him take,
þreo of his enemys he mot forsake:
þe world, his fflesch, þe fend þat is;

EPIGRAPH.Q: Liber generacionis Jhesu Christi fili Dauid (Math. 1, 1-16).

LG.L: ÞE Bok of Jhesu cristes kuynde,
þe sone of Dauid, ha we in muynde.
he þat is verrey God and Mon,
þe sone is cleped Abraham.
Abraham gat Ysaak þo.
Ysaak gat Jacob also.
Jacob gat Judas anon
And his Breþeren euerichon.
Judas gat, as we beo war,
Phares and Ȝaram, of Thamar.
Sone þeraftur þat Phares
Gat Esrom wiþ-outen lees.
Esrom, he þenne gat
Anoþur Child þat Aram hat.
Aram gat, wiþ-outen gabbe,
A child þat hette Amynadabbe.
Amynadab gat wiþ Riht
him þat in name Naȝon hiht.
Naason sone þenne gat he
Salmon, þat was so fre.
Salmon, he gat þon
Bos of Raab, þat wommon.
Bos wente forþ in trouþe
And he gat Obeth of Ruthe.
Obeth gat Jesse, to telle,
As bereþ witnesse þis gospelle.
Jesse gat, wiþ-outen lesyng,
him þat was cald Dauid þe kyng.
And þe goode kyng Daui
Gat Salomon soone, þat was witti,
Of hire þat þo called was
Vries wyf in þat plas—
hire nome nis not here present,
ffor heo to monnes deþ asent.
Salomon, þat was so wys,
Gat Roboam of muche prys.
And he þat so Roboam hette,
he gat Abias wiþ-outen lette.
Abias, haue we no drede,
he gat Ason in his dede.
Ason þenne gat in game
þat Josephath hette bi name.
Josephath, þat I of say,
Joram he gat, wiþ-outen nay.
Joram aftur in a stounde
Oȝias gat, as hit is founde.
Oȝias, þat was bold,
Gat Joatan, as hit is told.
Joatan nas not to lat,
Sone þer-aftur he Achaȝ gat.
Achaȝ þenne in tyme schert

Eȝechias gat in pres
him þat hette Manasses.
Manasses, he gat þon
him þat was I-called Amon.
Amon þenne wiþ good wille

Josyas, of whom we speke,

LG.L: Herkeneþ now, I wol ȝow telle
As Mathew seiþ in þis gospelle.
Jhesus com þat tyme in heiȝ
To þe cuntre of Ceesar philippi,
Askinde his disciples þere
And seide to hem þat wiþ him were:
"whom sigge ȝe men of þis Cuntre
þat þe sone of mon scholde be?"
þen seide his disciples to crist:
"Summe seyen, Jon þe Baptist,
And summe seyen Elesye,
And summe forsoþe seyn Jeremye,
Or on of þe prophetes here
Men seyn hit is in alle manere."
þo seide Jhesus openly:
"whom wol ȝe seyn þenne ho am I?"
Symon Peter onswerde þon
And þus to seye he bigon:
"þou art crist, heuene-kyng,
þe sone of God, holy liuyng."
Jhesu onswerde wiþ feir mod
And seide to petur, þer he stod:
"I-blesset þou art and ma,
þat art cleped Symon Bariona:
ffor bi flesch ne blod, I sei þe,
Miht þis not to þe brouht be,
But þorw my ffader þat is in heuen
was hit þe brouht wiþ mylde steuen.
Soþly, nou to þe sei I:
þou art stedefast, trewe as ston is tri:
vppon þe, petur, trewe as ston,
I schal buylde my chirche anon,
Aȝeyn wȝuche chirche, I þe say,
þe ȝates of helle not stonde may.
And I schal ȝiue þe keyes euene
Of ȝates of þe kyndom of heuene.
And what þou euere In eorþe dost bynde,
In heuene bounde schal men hit fynde:
And what þou vnbyndest in eorþe here,
In heuene vnbounde beo hit clere."
þis is þe tixt of vre gospelle,
As seint Matheu doþ vs telle.
Grete clerkes doþ vs teche
what þis gospel is to preche.
þis phelip Cesar þat we of kenne,
was heroudes broþer, þe ȝongur, þenne,
In hos tyme, soþ hit is,
God suffrede his passiun, I-wis.
In his ffader tyme þon
was I-bore boþe god and mon,
As hit is in stories seid
And for witnesse in bokes leyd.
þat Philip in honour of Cesar forþi
Let make a Citee feir and heiȝ,
And in his nome and Cesar also
he clepte hit Cesar philip þo,
And in þat cuntre Bi North and Souþ
Cesar philip hit is cald wiþ mouþ.
þe kynges of Rome þat þo were newe,
þat forþur in þis storie suwe,

þerfore vs þinkeþ worþi hit was,
þer eorþly kynges her tribut tas

vchon in his owne degre,
þat þer þe kyng of heuene hiȝe

þat tribut is studefast bileeue,

þerfore he seide to hem þon

Ne also he asked hit not of hame

þe feiþ þat (he) hem tauhte and bad.

ffor whon he seide to hem þus

þerfore he seide to hem freo

Petur onswerde in hiȝing
'þou art cristes sone, heuene-kyng.'

ffor bi flesch and blod, certeynly,

Bariona, þat we of mone,

A Coluer sone he was bi riht,

ffor mekelich and swetelich þat tym

Euer was he godus sone to deuyne
wiþ-outen ende tofore þat tyme,
And Petur aftur Godus child he was
wiþ oþur chosen bi godus gras.
Petur was godus child from þat tyme þo:

ffor alle þe wisdam of blod ne flesch

To his disciplus seide þis þing:
"Mi biddyng, forsoþe, hit is
þat ȝe loue to-gedere, i-wis,
As I haue ȝou, to sen,
while I haue among ȝou ben.
No mon, forsoþe to say,
More loue haue ne may
þen he þat putteþ his lyf clere
ffor his frendes þat ben him dere.
Ȝif ȝe do þat I ow bidde,
þen beo ȝe for my frendes kidde.
I sey not to ȝow in þis chaunce,

ffor he þat is a seruaunt so,

fforsoþe, I haue i-seid to ȝou
Mi frendes in my place nou:
ffor al þing þat I herd haue

And as my frendes in ow hit sowen.
ȝe ha not chosen me, to seyn,

And I haue put ow, forþ to go
ffruit to bringe forþ to mo,

And what ȝe asken euerichone
Of my fadur In my nome,
he schal hit sone to ow ȝiue,

þis is þe strengþe of vre gospel,

þe fruit of worldly doynge

In þat blisse, briht schynynge,
Jhesu lord vs þider bringe.

EPIGRAPH.Q: Rogabat Jhesum quidam phareseus (Luc. 7, 36-50). V. 23-100 ist identisch mit v. 1-76 der ersten Evangeliengeschichte dessel∣ben Ms. (ediert im Archiv 1877, p. 241), wo indessen die nördlichen Spuren we∣niger verwischt sind.

LG.L: WOrldus weole Made Marie wede,
whil heo was child in hire feirhede;
heo caste hire Maidenhed awei,
whon heo ȝaf hire to synful play.
Ofte makeþ þis worldus wynne
þeos feire wymmen falle in synne!
heo liued longe In lecheri,
Ar crist hedde of hire merci;
he com gostly to hire herte
And mad hire torne to good querte:
heo þouȝte heo hedde heuene tynt,
And sone of synne þo gon heo stint,
heo rewed of hire synnes ful sore
And ofte hedde care more and more.
Non þat hereþ speke of Mari,
Ne thar haue wonhope of godus merci.
ffor þeiȝ a mon do muche synne,
And he wole þerof blynne,
God of heuene is euer redi
To haue of him ful good merci.
þat was seene on Maudelayn,
þat mony synful makeþ fayn.—
Seint Luc, þe gode gospeller,
Telleþ vs on what maner
þat þis ilke sunful Mari
hedde forȝiuenes and Merci.
he seiþ þat in þat ilke toun
woned a Mon þat hette Symoun,
þer Marie woned whon þat ho
hedde wille penance to do.
þulke Symound was Mesele;
But crist hedde ȝiuen him his hele.
he hedde I-nouh wher-of to liue
And almus to þe pore to ȝiue.
he preyed crist, as auntur felle,
wiþ him to þe mete to dwelle;
And crist, þat seknes from him hed kest,
Com and eet wiþ him as gest.
Soone whon Mari herde say
þat crist schulde dwelle to mete þat dai,
heo com þer as crist was set.
wiþ wordus feire heo him gret,
wiþ teres þer heo wosch his feet
þat heo of hire eȝen leet,
heo wept hem aftur wiþ hire hare,
And custe hem ofte wiþ swete fare;
heo anoynt hem wiþ an oynement,
þat alle feled swetnesse þer present.
þat oynement i-bouht heo hadde
To anoynte hire bodi badde,
To make swote smelle hire bodi,
while heo vsede hire foli.
þis Symound þat i spac of ere,
Biheold þis wommons loueli here:
he þouȝte, for crist was pro∣phete,
heo scholde not ha touched his feete,
And als, him þouȝte, wite þat ho
weore vnworþi þat dede to do:
ffor synne mad hire vnworþi
To touche him þat was holi.
And as Symound þouȝte þis,
Crist wuste what he þouȝte, i-wis,
And seide: "Symound, tak hede to me,
I haue sum þing to speke to þe."
Symound onswerde and seide him tille:
"Sei on, Mayster, what is þi wille."
Crist him seide a saumple þon,
And seide: "hit was a Riche mon,
þis Riche mon hedde dettours two
þat ouȝten to him moneye þo:
On ouȝte to him fifti penys,
Anoþur an hundred or þe prys.
Nouþur of þo men, soþ to say,
hedde peny to make wiþ his pay:
he hem forȝaf heore dettes boþe,
wiþ-outen stresse or eny loþe.
wheþur of þeos two in plas
Most holden to him was?"
Symound onswerde crist ful sone,
As him þhouȝte hit was to done,
And seide: "to whom he most for∣ȝaue,
Most loue schulde to him haue."
Crist seide anon: "þow demest riht.
þus fareþ þe dette of synful wiht.
I com hidere as vncouþ mon:
watur to my feet ȝaf þou non;
þis wommon haþ wass chen my feet
wiþ salte teres þat heo leet,
heo haþ maad hire heo bare
And wyped my ffeet wiþ hire hare.
Cos ȝaf þou me non heer-Inne:
To cusse my ffeet con heo not blynne. . . .
hire synne forȝiuen is and away,
ffor muche loue þat heo haþ don to-day.
þe lasse þat mon loueþ me,
þe lasse synne may forȝiuen be.
But for hire loue is to me lele,
I forȝiue hire synnes fele."
God seide: "go, wommon, in pes,
ffor al þi synne forȝiuen is."
þis is þe strengþe of vr gospel,
As Mon in englisch [tonge may tel].
Whon we þenken, soþ to seyn,
Of þis synful Maudeleyn
And on þe wepyng þat heo tok
whon þat heo hir synnes forsok,
More likyng may we haue to wepe
þen eny oþur murþe to kepe.
þis wommon, ar heo lafte hire synne,
fful vnwrast heo was wiþ-Inne,
heo nolde no good techyng tast,
But wrouhte hir owne wille in wast.
Til a tyme þat fel in quert,
þat Jhesu com in to hire hert.
To precen in heo not let
þer þei weore to mete iset.
ffurst heo offred to god on heih
Teres, wepyng ful bitterli,
And al for hire synne hit was—
þus bi-gon heo in þat plas,
AMong þe gestes þat þer seete
heo lette not for schome to wepe.
þat ilke same Marie hit is
Of whom Mark bereþ witnis
þat seue deuelen at þe last
weore from hire out cast.
Marie seue deuelen hadde,
wiþ alle vices heo was ladde.
But whon þis wommon bihuld
þe place of fulþe in hire ibuld,
heo Ron, soþly for to telle,
Of Merci to þat holy welle,
þer to wasshe hire al at ene
And fulliche to make hire clene.
To vr lord heo brouhte þo
An Oynement ful swete also,
fforte abate þe foule stynk
Of hire fflessches lykyng.
wiþ þe Oynement so neuȝ
heo anoynt þe feet of Jhesu;
heo bigon lowe in kynde,
ffor heo wolde heiȝe clymbe.
ffor heo hedde ek coueyted vnriht
Of worldly þing wiþ eȝen siht,
hire eȝen þer heo dude despise
wiþ gret wepyng in alle wyse.
And for heo hedde also beo proud
And of hire hed wondur stout,
wiþ þat her heo wipte wiþ wille
þe teres þat on his feet dude trille.
ffor heo hedde I-spoken als
wiþ hire mouþ muche and fals,
And þat Mouþ assent to mene
To cussynges lechours vnclene,
wiþ þat Mouþ stunt heo nouht,
Cristes feet to cusse heo souht.
wiþ alle hire lymes herbifore
þat hedden synne I-vsed ȝore,
heo hem torned in þis cas
To Godus seruyse bi his gras,
wȝuche bifore by foul haunt
To synne weore ful seruaunt.
þis synful wommon furst vnsleih,
God forȝaf hire sikerly!
And seide to hire on þis manere
As ȝe schul aftur here;
Of mony synnes heo was releset,
And for heo god loued muchel and plesed,
And for heo schulde nomore do so,
he seide: "wommon, in pes þou go."
þerfore, breþeren, beo we bolde
Penaunce forte take and holde;
Beo we not þerto febul þan,
Take we ensaumple at þis womman:
þenne touche we sone to þe feet
Of vre sauiour so sweet.
Boldly penaunce is þe Roote 177 l. bodily.
Of forȝiuenes, þe beste bote.
þe same fflesch þat dude þe synne,
Penaunce in hit we moste bigynne—
ffor þat is beter mony-fold
þen hit to bugge wiþ seluer and gold.
ffurst we moste bigynne þus:
Serwe for synne take wiþ vs.
þat may ȝe lerne wiþ-oute fable
Bi a Beest vnresonable:

LG.HEAD: Of a best þat is like a man in visage.
LG.L: IN Bok a best we fynde con
þat haþ a face as a Mon.
whon hit hungreþ, forþ he geþ,
ffint a Mon and him he sleþ,
he fedeþ him on þat bodi
And goþ to drinke to watur neih.
whon he comeþ to þat place
And in þat watur seoþ his face,
þen he biþenkeþ him vnfayn
þat he his liknesse haþ slayn;
Such serwe to him he takeþ,
his lyf sone he forsakeþ.
þis is aȝeyn þeos wymmen
þat ouerliggen heor children þen,
ffor þei slen þer bi distresse
þat is heore owne liknesse.
But þei amende hem ar þei go, 203 þei st. men?
Godus liknesse þey slen also,
þat is þis, to biginne,
fforsoþe her oune soule wiþ-Inne.
his soule he sleþ in his dede
whil he his flesch wiþ synne wol fede.
At þis Beest wiþ-oute resoun
Take ensaumple alle we moun
Serwe to vr-self to take
And for vr synnes amendes make.
hou we schulle þat dede don,
I wol ȝou telle feire and son.
Penaunce is a salue sleih
To hele synne þat is dedly.
Penaunce do hit hose wol,
he schal hit fynde nedful;
Ȝif he trewely þerin wende,
hit is spedful at þe ende;
To don hit is a noble dede,
we schul fynde hit ful of mede.
Neodful þenne to vs hit is
And to almonkynde, I-wis:
ffor ouþur schul we don hit here,
Or aftur we ben ileid on bere;
Neede reherseþ in þis caas
þat we may not from hit pas.
Betur weor here ȝeres tweyn
þen þer a day, soþ to seyn;
ffor þat a mon schal þer fulfille,
hit is muche aȝeynes his wille;
So muche þonk naþ not he
As þat he doþ of wille fre.

LG.HEAD: Off mirre-tre þat ȝiueþ two-maner gummes.
LG.L: A Maner tre, forsoþe, we fynde
þat Mirre ȝiueþ be wei of kynde;
Two Maner of Mirres from him goþ:
On wiþ loue, anoþur wiþ loþ;
þe ton is taken out bi craft,
And þe toþur freoly laft.
But þat þat so geten may beo
Bi fre wille out of þe treo,
hit is þe beter, beo ȝe bold,
And more of miht an hundred-fold.
So is þat penaunce, forsoþe,
þat mon of his freo wille doþ.

LG.HEAD: hou a brid wan he fleth maket a cros.
LG.L: A foul þat vp his fliȝt schal take,
ffurst a cros he mot make;
whon he in þat ilke tyde
his whinges casteþ on eiþer syde,
þen lok his hed and to his tayl:
And of a cros þou maiȝt not fayl.
ȝif we þerfore wole vp flyȝe,
To cros of penaunce mote we hiȝe.
ffor ȝif þou scholdes a burþen bere
þat heui weore þe to dere,
wher were hit betur þi-self hit do
Or haue a felawe to helpe to?
þis ilke burþun penaunce, i-wis,
To bere hit þus, my red hit is,
whil þi bodi, þat is his fere,
In eorþe is wiþ þi soule here;
ffor beter may ȝe bere hit so
þen on bi him-self to go.
ffor o day in eorþe here
Releseþ In purgatorie a ȝere;
þis forsoþe þe skil mot beo:
ffor hit comeþ of wille freo.

LG.HEAD: A man haþ Ms. had. two-maner londes to ferme.
LG.L: Two maner of londes breme
vche mon haþ her to ȝeme:
To terme of ȝeres þe ton to seyn,
But þei ben in noun-certeyn;
þe toþur is of beter store,
hit is ffee for euer-more. 274 Ms. in st. is.
ȝif we wiþ muche cost gouerne
þat lond þat we haue to ferme,
whon vs best lykeþ þer to play
hit schal beo take from vs away.
þerfore is betur þat we spende
þe gode tresour þat god vs sende,
To tile nobliche þat lond
þat neuer schal out of vre hond;
þen whon þe ferme-lond is take,
þer we may vs muri make.
þeos londes þat I here of mene,
Bodi and soule þei ben atene.
þi bodi is terme of ȝeres so,
þou nost what tyme hit to forgo.
Lei not þeron to muche trauayle,
ffor hit wol þenne at neode fayle;
But lei þi cost and þi kepyng
vppon þi soule, þat heiȝe þing:
ffor hit schal neuer-more dye,
weole or wo wheþer hit drie.
Sette and sowe þer-in Inowe
Penaunce and gode vertuwes to growe.—
þus may we seo bi word and dede
þat penaunce moste beo don neede.
Spedful als hit is anon:
To heuene hit makeþ men sone to gon,
To þat blisse þat is so hiȝe,
In þe twynklynk of an eiȝe.
Medful also þenne hit is:
hit makeþ a Mon to wone in blis;
þat schal he haue wiþ-oute distaunce
Euere, for he dude penaunce.—
vre penaunce þen moste we do
hastily, and lastyngly also.

LG.HEAD: Off a fisch þat euere slepeth.
LG.L: ÞEr is a ffisch, wiþ-oute lesynge,
þat in þe see is walkynge,
Euere he slumbreþ and eke slepeþ,
Bote whonne he to his mete kepeþ;
whon he is so in slep þrowe,
A Mon may vnneþes knowe
wheþer he lyueþ eny-þing,
But bi a luytel meuyng.
Comeþ þe ffisschere wiþ his net
And abouten him he set,
þen is he taken so vnfayn,
And so in sleuþe is he slayn.
þe ffisch is he þat nul not hiȝe
To do penaunce hastilye,
But liþ slepynge in þe séé,
þat worldus catel cald may be.
þe more þerof a Mon drinke,
þe sarre afurst him schal þinke;
vnneþe in him is eny lyue,
Touward heuene him to driue,
Not ones par auntur in þe wike
A pater noster to biseke.
Comeþ þe deuel atte laste
And caccheþ him in his net faste,
þer he sleþ him, soþ to telle,
ffor he makeþ him go to helle.
To do penaunce hit is ful late
whon þe deþ is at þe ȝate.
þerfore penaunce moste ben
hastely don, as we mouwe sen.—
Lastingly, hose wol be meke,
he moste do his penaunce eke.
ffor þeih þe ffend venymous,
þat euere haþ Envye to vs,
Makeþ vs vr penaunce to berste,
As ofte doþ he for þe worste,
Schriue we vs wiþ good wille
And take we hit aȝeyn vs tille;
þouȝ hit beo bitter to vr flesch,
To vr soule hit is ful nesch.
Moyses caste his ȝerde him fro,
In to a Neddre hit wox þo;
vr lord bad him for his geyn
Take hit bi þe tayl aȝeyn:
Aȝeyn he tok hit bi þe ende
And in to a ȝerde dude hit wende.
ȝif we vr penaunce take so,
To heuene hit wole make vs go.
þenne is þis good ordinaunce
Lastyngly to do penaunce;
And þat we moste do freoly,
Bi þe Mirre-treo ȝou told I.
Bi vr bodi set we no-þing,
Bute vr soule to blisse to bring.
Ensaumple þerof may we take
And bi a wylde brid hit make.

LG.HEAD: On ensample of a bryd in a cage.
LG.L: A Brid In to a Cage cauht,
þer-In he liueþ ful vnsauht,
he rewardeþ mete ne drynke
Nor on song wol he þenke,
But lokeþ euer niht and day
hou he mihte skape away,
To his kuynde wolde he pas
þat he furst fro taken was;
At eueri hole of þat Cage
he a-wayteþ to has passage.
So schulde we here bi riht
Awayte euer day and niht
hou we mihte out breke
Of þis world we ben in steke,
And comen to vre kuynde aȝeyn,
þat is paradys, certeyn.
hose wol do þus, sone he comeþ
To þat blisse þer Maudeleyn woneþ.
he vs sende þat ilke grace
þat brouȝt hire to heuene-place.

EPIGRAPH.Q: Accessit ad Jhesum mater filiorum Ȝebedei (Math. 20, 20-23).

LG.L: Vppon a tyme as Jhesu went,
To him a wommon com present,
þe Modur heo was, as I sei þe,
Of þe sones of Ȝebede;
Gret worschipe to him heo dude
And asked him sumwhat in þat stude.
Jhesu asked hire what heo wolde.
And heo anon to him tolde:
"Graunte me þat my children tweyn
Mou sitten as I schal now seyn: 10 l. mon.
þe ton on þi Riht half to byde,
þe toþur on þi luft syde,
In þi kyngdom þer þou schalt leende
Euer-more wiþ-outen ende."
Jhesu onswerde wiþ wille fre:
"what ȝe aske wite not ȝe."
he seide to þe children wys:
"May ȝe drinke of þat chalys
þat i schal drinke herafturward?
Loke hit beo not to ȝou to hard!"
þei onswerde wiþ-outen nay:
"Ȝe, lord," þei seide, "do hit we may."
vr lord seide to hem þan:
"hose of my chalys drynke can 24 ff. setzen einen ver∣derbten lat. Text voraus.
And trewely wole þat drynke abyde,
Sitte he schal on my riht syde;
Bote to me hit is no-þing
To graunte þis oþur askyng,
On my luft syde for to sit—
þat askyng nis not al bi wit;
Non oþur þerto schal come
Bote þeose men alle and some
þat my ffadur haþ to demeyned
And also for hem hit ordeyned."
þis is þe strengþe of vre gospel,
As Mon in Englisch mai ow tel.
Þis wommon þat þus com þore,
was Modur of Jon and Jamus þe more;
Sones þei weore, wiþ-outen stryf,
Of Ȝebede, and heo þe wyf.
þis wommon here asked and chees
To haue worldli worþines,
To hire children heo wolde hit haue,
þerfore þus heo dude hit craue.
þer as vr lord hem asked riht
wher þei of his chalis drinke miht,
þat was þe deþ þat he schulde take
Only for Monkuynde sake.
Anon þei hit graunted wel
And seide ȝe of eueridel:
þis was to seye, sikerlye,
Riht as crist for mon schulde dye,
þe deþ þei schulde take grym
ffor þe knowleching of him.
ffor Jhesu hedde biforen seid
þat he schulde to deþ beo leid
And þe þridde day arise
And Regne þenne as heiȝ Justise:
þis wommon wende and hedde trist
þat aftur his holy vprist
he schulde ha ben a bodily kyng
her on eorþe regnyng
And deled worldly godus in pres
To hem þat he toforen ches;
þus bi worldly Couetyse
heo was stured in þis wyse.
Jhesu seide to hem 'dere,
Ȝe witen not what ȝe asken here.'
þe Modur of þeos children two
þus asked þis þyng þo,
Ȝit nolde crist hire not blame,
Bote þo children þer bi name,
ffor bi pouwer of his godhede
he vndurstode, haue we no drede,
þe þing þat heo hedde asked þan
Of hire children furst hit cam.—
Bi þis wordus heer-bifore
Crist scheweþ of soffring sore,
þat a mon soffre mote
Mony diseses for his bote
In þis world whil he wol byde,
ȝif he wol sitte on his riht syde.
Jamus soffring nas not bihynde,
As þis day makeþ mynde;
he dronk of godus chalys clere—
þerof beo we out of were;
As we rede In his legende may,
he was byhedet, hit nis not nay;
Such was þenne his suffringe
Bi ffals heroudes biddynge.
Bote of his goode broþur Jon
So fel hit not sone anon;
Of his lyf was mad non ende
Bi Martirdom, whon he schulde wende.
But of þe chalys he dronk a fit
whon he in to þe tonne was pit
fful of wellyng oyle sad,
As þe luþur Domician bad;
And also in a-noþur plas:
Bifore Aristodum he was
And þer he dronk wiþ wille grym
Bitter Atter and eke venym—
But forsoþe hit greued him nouȝt,
Bi Crist awey hit was I-brouȝt;
Also he was to scourgyng sende,
As witnesseþ his legende.—106 Ms. þis.
herbi may we wel seo
þat heuene-kyngdom mai not beo
Onliche ȝiuen bote to hom
þat muche serwe suffren hem on;
As hos seiþ, such as ȝe are
To heuene-kyngdom ȝe may not fare,
Bote suche as ȝe ben schal
To heuene may ȝe come wiþ-al.
þer as he seide 'myn hit nis
To graunten ȝow askyng þis',
þat was to mene, soþ to say,
whil þei in pruide and heiȝnesse lay.
þerfore is good þat we seke
Euermore to beo meke,
And so may we come euene
To þe heiȝe blisse of heuene.
But hose wol haue þat ilke blis,
he mot him chaunge from þat he is—
I þe telle, leoue broþur,
hit is elles ordeynd to oþur.
Beo we 'oþur' al at ene,
And þen is hit to vs to mene.
Bote what is þis for to say
Beo þe oþur, I ow pray?
Ȝe þat wole on hiȝ flyȝe,
Make ȝou here louhlye.
A ffoul whon he takeþ his fliht,
he loweþ him forte make him liht.
þe lower þat mon her beo,
þe herre to heuene schal he fleo.
þerfore liht we vs make,
þat we may þat wey take;
Clanse we vs of vre synne,
Let not heuines ben vs wiþ-Inne:
þen may we safly wende
To þe Joye wiþ-outen ende.
þider mote he vs bringe
þat maade of nouȝt alle þinge.

holy churche, þat is dere,

'God', he seiþ, 'in heuene was,

þat world is folliche forte mene

And in anoþur place, to se,

ffor, as Jon seiþ in dede,

þe world is here forte say

hateþ al-holi churche.
þen beo we þus þerate:
þe world doþ þe world hate.

Of þat lompe bi tyme and spas

weore mad vessels of merci,

he is wikked and vnwrest,

ffewe goode vertuwes cam,

ffor as þei me dude pursuwe,

vr lordes biddyng erli and late

EPIGRAPH.Q: Videns Jhesus turbas ascendit in montem (Math. 5, 1-12).

LG.L: Herkeneþ alle to þis gospel,
what Matheu herof wol us tel,
In þe feste of þis heiȝe-day
þat al halwen is to say.
Jhesus sayȝ, as seiþ þis storye,
Of peple muche a Cumpaynye,
And he wente feir and stille
vpon heih in to an hille,
And þer he set him doun anon.
his disciples to him gan gon,
And he his Mouþ feir openynge
Tauȝt hem þer ful derworþe þinge,
And þus to sey he bigan,
þat lord þat was God and Man.
þus he seide, as I sei þe:
"þe pore of spirit blesset þei be:
ffor I ow sey wiþ mylde steuene,
heoren is þe kyngdom of heuene.
Also Blesset mote þei be
þat ben Meke wiþ herte fre:
ffor sikerly þei schal haue
Erthly possessions, hem to saue.
I-blesset beo þo þat make serw∣ynge:
ffor I schal sende hem cumfortynge.
Blesset beo þat þat han þat miht
To hongrun and þursten aftur riht:
ffor, ȝif þei in þis Maner beo sted,
I schal ordeynen þat þei beo fed.
Blessed beo þe Merciful vchone
þat Merci nis not wiþ hem wone:
ffor I schal so ordeyne heore pay,
þat Merci schal hem folewen ay.
Blesset mote þei clene of hertes beo:
ffor God Almihti schul þei seo.
Blessed beo þe pesybles i-tald:
þe sones of god schul þei be cald.
Blesset beo þo þat day and niht
Soffre persecucions for þe riht:
ffor heores is þe kyngdom clene
þer as dwelleþ Crist I mene.
Blesset beo ȝe in hiȝinge
To whom þe world makeþ missig∣gynge
And persecucions to ȝow make
ffor my word and for my sake,
And vp-on ȝou seyȝen lesynge
ffor ȝe of me witnesse bringe:
Beoþ glad and also ful of blis,
ȝor Meede in heuene plentyuous is."
þis is þe strengþe of vre gospel,
As Mon in Englisch tonge may tel.
SEint Bede her scheweþ forþi
And expouneþ þis Ewangeli,
And seiþ þe ffeste of þis day
was vnknowe, soþ to say,
To prestes, techers and Confessours,
þat serueden God wiþ honours,
þe wȝuche techers dude Moyste wel
þe hertes of trewe men eueridel.
þat Moysture is gode techinges
þat gostly vs to blisse bringes;
And such scholde þis techinge be founde
þat profitable fruit scholde þeron grounde;
þat fruit þat so comeþ of prest and clerk,
Cal I þe fruit of godus werk.
ffor þo þat prechen godus word,
þo ben Besauns of godus hord,
wȝuche þat god haþ take to hem
To dele to alle cristene men.
ȝif þei hit holden hem-self wiþ-Inne,
Aboute to dele hit wol not bi∣ginne,
þeoues þei ben apertely
þat so stele godus tresory.
þerfore þei scholde in eueri route
Teche hit to þe pepul aboute,
And liuen hem-self good lyuinge:
þen seruen þei god, heuene-kynge.
ffor doctours þat weore sum-tyme,
þauȝ þei of swerd feled no pyne,
Martyres in þis Maner þei were:
In liuyng of heore lyf ful clere;
ffor hit is noble Martirdom
To liue in alle manere a clene mon.
A Martir only proued nis not he
To schede his blod, so ded to be, 84 l. who schedeþ.
But he þat wol abstene him
ffrom alle fulþus and alle syn,
And vseþ alle godus Comaundemens
And noþing doþ to his defens.
Whi God went vp in to an hille,
Good hit is to telle ȝow tille.
An hul, ȝe wite wel, hit is hiȝe:
So dude god in grace vp stiȝe
þis day to teche þis lessun wys—
Of alle lessuns hit bereþ þe pris.
þerfore to an hul ȝede he, 95 Ms. seide st. ȝede.
ffor herre lessun mihte non be.
þere he seide: 'I telle ȝow,
Blesset mote þe pore of spirit be nou,
ȝif þei pouert holde and haue
ffor loue of him þat schal hem saue.'
pore of spirit ben þise men
þat Meke ben and drede god þen,
And þo þat make no couetynge
To erthli ni to fflescly þinge;
hose put him furst in good ordringe,
So may he furst come in blessynge.
þer he blesset þe Meke þan:
possessiouns eorþli scholde þei han.
þei beo Meke icald a-rewe
þat no ȝeyn-stondyng her enemys schewe,
þat nouþur bi dede ne word ispeke
Of her enemys nil hem not wreke,
But gladly wole for Godus sake
Suffre pyne, teone and wrake,
And wiþ Maystrie aȝeinstonde hit nouȝt,
Bot ouercome hit wiþ goodnes wrouȝt.
þei schul folwe þe lombe,
wher-so-euer he go or stonde.
þat lomb is Jhesu, ful of Meth,
þat for vs alle soffrede deþ.
'Blessed beo þo þat sori are'
And for heore synnes in herte ha care,
And for heor neihȝebors synne and sake
Muche del and mournyng make;
ffor þat dede þat þei so do,
Godus kyndam schul þei come to.
ffor þe ffingres of god ful hiȝe
Schul wiþe þe teres from heor eiȝe,
And þei schul haue cumfort most,
þat schal come of þe holigost.
whon þei han lost eorþly lyf here,
þei schul ha lyf in heuene clere;
ffor þei þat preyen wiþ wepynge,
Schul gedere fruit wiþ Joyinge.
Also spekeþ þe prophecye
þise wordus bi Ysaye:
'wo to ȝou þat lauhtres make
Of ȝoure synnes and nil not slake;
ffor as muche Joye as ȝe make now,
wel more serwe schal come to ȝow.'
þei þat make lauhtur and game
Of heore neiȝhebores harm and schame,
And in Idel heor tyme þei lese,
And muche God þei displese.
þer Jhesu seide ful of miht
'Blessed beo þe hungri aftur riht:
ffor in þat place ful heiȝe ibult,
þer schal þei beo ful wel I-fult:'
Aftur Riht to hongrun and þurst,
To kepe þe Comaundemens to ha lust,
To kepe hem wel, I sey apliht,
And hem to serue day and niht:
þei beo coueyted of god wiþ loue,
þat wole hem bringe to blisse aboue.
'Blesset beo þe Merciful vchan
þat euer merci wiþ hem han':
þo ben þei, I telle hit þe,
þat helpen wrecches þat nedi be;
ffor þer þei haue pite of hom,
Merci hem folweþ sone anon.
Ensaumple þerfore may we lere,
As þis feste reherseþ here,
Of Ten Maydens, weore sum-tyme þo,
ffyue wyse and fyue foles also.
þeos fyue gode forsoke þon
To beo couplet to eny mon,
þei nolde leue heore clannes
ffor no worldly Riches,
But euere þei seruede heuene-kyng,
In word, In þouht and doing.
Do we so þenne as dude þay:
we wite wel, come schal domes-day;
Do we, wiþ him knowe to be
þat schal sitte and Jugge vs in se.
þen wol he take vs to him,
As he þe virgynes dude þat tym,
And bringen vs to þat blis
þer as þei wiþ him-seluen is.
To þat blisse he vs bringe,
þat in world of worldus is regninge.
IN þat tyme God Jhesus
To his disciples seide þus:
"ȝe beon salt, I ow say,
Of þe eorþe, hit is no nay.
But ȝif salt euanissche fro
þing þat hit is salted in so?
hit nis nomore worþi, we rede,
Bote beo cast out in dede
And defoulet fer men fro—
To oþur profyt may hit not go.
Ȝe ben also þe liht clere
Of þe world, to me dere.
Men may not huyde a gret cite,
ȝif hit is set on an heiȝ hul to be.
Nor men takeþ not of a lanterne þe liht
And put vndur a strik vnriht,
Bote on a Candelstikke on hiȝ,
To lihten alle in house worþi.
So lihten ȝe ȝor liȝt in place
Bifore men, þorwh gret grace,
þat þei ȝor goode werkes may sen
wȝuche idon bi ow schal ben,
þat þei þerfore may glorifye
ȝor fadur þat is in heuene heiȝe.
Ne leeueþ not I com ȝow to
þe lawe or prophecies to vndo;
To vndo hem com not I,
Bote to folfulle hem, sikerli."
þis is þe strengþe of vre gospel,
As Mon in Englisch may ow tel.
Grete clerkes forto proue,
þat loueden wel her god aboue,
Expouneden þis gospel on þis wyse
þat ȝe schul here wiþ-outen feyntyse.
God seide þeos wordus same
þat for knowlechyng of his name
þei schulde suffre moni a teene—
And so þei duden al-bi-deene.
And for þei schulden I-cumforted be,
More to hem heer seide he.
þe kyng of heuene, þat al walt,
Seide, of þe eorþe þei schulde be salt.
Salt to vndurstonde gostly
Is wisdam, siker to ȝou sei I.
Salt of þis eorþe here
Bi hete of fuir from watur clere
And also bi blowyng of wynde
Is tornd out of watres kynde
In to salt, as we may seo
Ofte-tyme among vs beo.
Riht so þe apostles for to mene
And heore folweres alle bidene
Bi holy watur of Baptiȝinge
And bi hete of feiþ brennynge
And also bi enspiraciun trie
Of þe holigost so hiȝe
ffrom erþly þinges chaunged beo þei
In to heuenly þinges, soþ to sey.
þe kuynde of salt þen is þus:
hit druyeþ vp mo(i)stnussus,
And stunch hit doþ awei in dede,
And soffreþ no quik worm to brede.
So druiȝeþ heuenlich wisdam
Moistnesses of ffleschlich dilites þan,
And also hit doþ awey þe stink
Of vuel liuyng in alle þing,
hit kepeþ from mon sikerli
þe quike worm of lecheri;
Of whom Ysaye in vre feiþ
þeose wordus scheweþ and seiþ:
'þe worm of þe lechours hyne
Schal neuer dye in no tyme,
Ne þe fuir of hem so stout
hit schal neuer beo quenched out.'
In þe olde testament we fynde,
As we reden and han in muynde:
þer schulde beo offred non offringe
To god, þat is heuene-kynge,
But hit weore furst i-sauered wel
wiþ salt aboute eueridel;
þis is þus muche for to say:
No mon wel make may
An Offringe worschupful
To God, þat al godnes wol,
wiþ-outen þe sauour of þe craft
Of heuenlich wisdam in him laft.
Poul seiþ also in place
þeos wordus ful of grace:
'þe wordus of ȝou wel sauered mot be
In þe grace of god bi wisdom fre.'
I ffynde in þe Bok of kynges
Acordyng sum-what to þeos þinges:
þat whon þe grete watres of Jerico
weore waxen bareyn and bitter also,
EliȜeacute;é, þe gode prophete,
preyed þerfore to god so swete;
And god of his grace him sende
And tauȝte him þus hem to amende:
EliȜeacute;é anon him biþouht
And comaundet a vessel to be brouht
fful of salt, and he hit caste
In to þe hed of þe watres faste:
And sone þei hedden heor kynde aȝeyn,
As hit is writen, in certeyn.
Salt is vndurstonden here
þe Godhede of god so clere,
And þe vessel þat hit was Inne
was his Monhede wiþ-outen synne.
þer as þis salt so wel
was put in to þat vessel,
þat was, whon þe godhed stronge
was entred in to Marie wombe
And so com and dwelled in vs,
God and Mon swete Jhesus.
þer þe salt In þe vessel was
þrowen in to þe hedes bi gras
Of þe watres, soþ to seyn,
þat weore bitter and bareyn,
And anon as we fynde
þei tornde aȝeyn in to heor kynde:
þis is to vndurstonden euene:
whon godus sone, þe wisdam of heuene,
hedde folfuld þe priuetes
Of his passion in alle degrees,
þe watures bitter and vnseete
were ymad boþe gode and swete;
þat was þat Monkynde, to telle,
þat was in bitter pyne of helle,
was þo restored in certeyn
To heuene to his kynde aȝeyn.
But þenne ȝif salt passe awey,
In whom hit is salted to sey?
As hos seiþ, ȝif we passe þerfro
þat God haþ chosun to beo salt so,
þat is to sei wisdom hende,
vs to kepe from þe fende:
þen go we wrong to wo.
Oþere, siker schul not so,
wȝuche ben sauered and studefast,
In heuenliche wisdam euer to last.
IN a tyme as goode Jhesus
Bi Jerico wente þus,
þer com a Mon þat Ȝachee hiht,
was prince of publicanus riht;
A Riche mon þenne was he.
he ȝeorned muche Jhesu to se,
ffor he wolde wite and quere
what-maner mon þat he were.
Of Jhesu miht he seo no-þing
ffor plente of pepul presyng,
ffor he was of makyng lowe,
Luytel for to seo and knowe.
In to a treo he wente þerfore,
A Sikamour, to seon him þore:
ffor þat wey Jhesu scholde
passe, as his wille wolde.
Whon Jhesu com to þat place,
he loked vp and sayȝ his face,
To him he seide: "Ȝachéé,
Go nou doun, and hiȝe þou þe:
ffor in þin hous, I þe telle,
þis ilke day moot I dwelle."
Ȝachee hiȝing wente doun,
And resseyued him wiþ Joyful soun.
whon þat pepul þis þer seih,
þei Merueyled, seiȝinge wondurly
þat Jhesu wolde turne þan
To such a maner synful man.
Ȝachee þenne, þer he stod,
Seide to vr lord so good:
"Del half my good, whil I liue,
To pore men wol I ȝiue;
Ȝif I ouȝt wiþ wrong haue holde,
I schal hit ȝelde aȝeyn foure∣folde."
Jhesus, þat is lord aboue,
Seide to him wiþ gret loue:
"hele þis day is fully maad
To þin hous, þou maiȝt beo glad:"
þerfore, to him þus seide he,
"ffor he was sone of Abraee.
þe sone of Mon þat was so meke
Com þat tyme for to seke
And for to make saaf also
þat to perisching schulde ha go."
þis is þe tixt of þis gospel,
As mon in Englisch tonge may tel.
IN þis holy teching heere
þis holy gospel good and clere
Scheweþ to vs and oþur mo
þat Jhesus wente to Jerico
And hou þat Ȝacheus hedde longinge
To seo his lord, heuene-kynge.
þis Ȝachee vndurstonden is
'he þat is maad Rihtwys',
And bitokneþ þe pepul of gentes
þat leeued in god bi heore ententes.
Jerico bitokneþ als
'þis wrecched world þat is fals':
ffor Jhesu wente ofte among
þis wrecched world ful of wrong.
þouȝ þis ȝachee weore mon wys
And of þat lawe bar þe prys,
More bi feiþ vr lord souhte he
þen bi lawe, as fynde we;
And for he was in feiþ studefast,
he deserued atte last
To resseyue þe benisoun
Of vr lord ful of renoun;
So ferforþ, þat vr lord so good
wolde him graunte wiþ mylde mood
To come in to hous his
And reste þer as kyng of blis.
he ȝaf him þenne, as lord hende,
Euerlastinge hele wiþouten ende.
þe same wyse þis pepul al
Of þe gentes, gret and smal,
vre lord bi lawe þei not kneuh,
But bi feiþ ful of vertu;
þerfore þei diseruet ryf
Of vr lord euerlastyng lyf.
þis ilke Sicomours tre
In wȝuche clomb vp Ȝachee,
was ful hiȝ and feir to siht,
And swete in schadewe and muche in miht,
And als in fruites plenteuous,
Most swettest and delicious.
And þis tre, so good and dere,
Mai wel be tokned here
To þat blessed Rode-treo
Of wȝuche we alle weore bouȝt freo.
þis sicamour was feir and heiȝ,
I wol ȝou telle þe resun whi:
A ladder was þerof maked
whon crist was sprad þeron naked,
þat out of helle þat laddur rauhte,
In to heiȝ heuene hit strauhte.
þat ilke wei wente ful euene
vr elder-ffadres to heiȝ heuene;
ffor hit was ful of honour
þat scholde so bere vr saueour.
Swete in schade also hit was,
As ȝe may here in þis plas:
hit schadewede from þe hote fuire
Of helle, þat euermore schal duire,
þe prophetes and þe patriarkes alle
þat Adam synne hedde mad falle.
Plentiuous in ffruit was þat treo—
Non oþur so plentiuous mihte beo;
þe fruit þat on þat treo greuȝ,
was Jhesu, ful of alle vertu.
þe fruit on þat o treo, we fynde,
Brouhte forþ þo almonkynde
ffrom endeles pyne to blisse aboue,
Euer to wonen wiþ him in loue.
Ȝachee also bitokne may
þis synful pepul boþe niht and day
þat for heore synnes mai haue no siht
Of god vr lord, kyng of miht.
But hose wole þe siht haue
Of god, his lord, þat may him saue,
In to þis treo he most climbe
Of Sikamour, as I hit fynde:
þat is to seche folli to loue
vre lord god alle þing aboue;
þat is to say he moste forsake
Alle synnes, in him so blake,
And beo boxum in alle þinges
To godus holy Biddynges,
And suffre wo in world here
ffor his loue þat bouht hym dere;
In to þat tre þus may he wende
And seon his lord wiþouten ende.
Nou forþurmore me mot biholde,
As hit is in vr gospel tolde;
whon vr lord, blesset he be,
Say þe feiþ of Sachee
he hiht him, as I ow telle,
In his hous þat day to dwelle;
þat was for he knoulechede clene
Al his trespas þer at ene,
And graunted þer Jhesus bifore
fforto amende for euermore.
Jhesus coueyted not to abyde
In hous of treo, maad wiþ pride,
But in þe clene soule of mon,
þer wolde he dwelle, þerfore he com.
þerfore I rede, we clanse vs,
þat we may resseyue him þus,
And þenne to kepe him so vs wiþ
Euer to lyuen in grace and griþ.
þen seide Ȝachéé to Jhesu,
þat is ful of alle vertu:
'Lo, lord, half my godus I ȝiue
To pore men, whil I lyue;
And ȝif I haue bi wrench or wile
Do to eny mon eny gyle,
To ȝelde aȝeyn I am ful bold
To vche mon foure-fold.'
ÞEn seide vr lord precious:
'þis day is hele mad to þyn hous,
ffor as muche as þou art þan
þe holy sone of Abraham.'
vche mon þat wol come
fforte ben Abrahames sone,
As longe as he liueþ sikerly
he moste ben aboute bisy
To folwe þe ensaumple in his dede
þat we here of Ȝachéé rede:
þat is to sey, wiþ wille feruent
Of goodus þat god him haþ isent
Ȝif þe pore for godus sake,
And so Abraham sone hym make.
Abraham is forto say
'ffadur of mony folk' verray—
þat is he þat for vs diȝed
And al his bodi wiþ blood biwriȝed.
Ȝif we kepen, breþeren dere,
Coueitousliche þeos goodes here
þat god him-self haþ vs lant,
And wol not parte hem wiþ vre hand,
Afert may we beo ful sore
Leste we gete peyne for euer more;
But ȝif we wole wiþ wille fre
Departe wiþ pore, as I sei þe,
we schul haue þat ilke lyf
þat euer schal laste wiþ-oute strif.
þerfore do we al vre entent,
whil we ben in eorþe present,
To trauayle boþe niht and day
Goode werkes to worchen ay;
So þat, whonne þe soule schal go
And beo parted þe bodi fro,
hit may clayme forte wende
To þat blise wiþ-outen ende.
